newsitem.title: SWEDEN: DIGITAL MOBILE PHONE SYSTEM USERS UP '96 - ERICSSON.
newsitem.headline: DIGITAL MOBILE PHONE SYSTEM USERS UP '96 - ERICSSON.

text.p: Swedish telecoms group Ericsson said on Monday that the number of mobile telephone subscribers surged 180 percent last year, preliminary statistics showed.
The total number of mobile phone subscribers, including analogue systems, rose 55 percent to 137 million, Ericsson chief executive Lars Ramqvist said in the company's annual report.

"We can also see that the strongest growth, 180 percent last year, could be found in the digital systems, where GSM, PDC and D-AMPS networks together reached more than 50 million subscribers," Ramqvist said.
"GSM has de facto become a world standard," he added.
Growth in digital systems reached 3.5 million new subscribers a month in the last few months of the year.
"This (growth) was almost completely seen in systems based on TDMA (Time Division Multiple Accesss) technology, where Ericsson is the leading supplier," Ramqvist said.
